datafield.subfield: ca. 1,700 prints : chiefly lithographs, b&w and color, 36 x 28 cm. or smaller.
These illustrated sheet music covers reflect varied aspects of American history, culture, and politics in the nineteenth century.

titlestmt.author: Prepared by Prints & Photographs Division Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Prints & Photographs Division, Library of Congress

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid converted Prints & Photographs Division staff May, 2002

did.head: Collection Summary

physdesc.label: Physical description
physdesc.extent: ca. 1,700 prints : chiefly lithographs, b&w and color, 36 x 28 cm. or smaller.

repository.label: Location
repository.corpname: Prints & Photographs Division Library of Congress

did.abstract: These illustrated sheet music covers reflect varied aspects of American history, culture, and politics in the nineteenth century.

note.p: For information about Prints and Photographs Division collections and services, see the Prints & Photographs Division's Reading Room Home Page.

The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

altformavail.head: Additional form available
altformavail.p: Digitized images of some items in the collection and their associated identifying information are available through the Prints & Photographs Online Catalog, by searching using the call number "LOT 10615."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: LOT 10615, Music cover collection, Prints & Photographs Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biog./History Note
bioghist.p: Publishers of nineteenth century sheet music used illustrated covers to promote sales of popular music

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Images reflect varied aspects of American history, culture, and politics of the nineteenth century. Examples of topics depicted include African Americans; animals; children; cities; the Civil War; daily life; dancing; educational institutions; emblems and symbols; entertainers; fashion; flags; genre scenes; landscapes; love and marriage; military personnel; musical instruments and people playing instruments; U.S. Presidents; sports; theater; transportation; and women.

arrangement.head: Organized/Arranged
arrangement.p: Organized by broad subject (Views, War, Portraits, Topics) with eighty-eight subdivisions.
